phase-3-complete-roadmap.description: Full implementation roadmap after tracer bullet works

milestone-1.name: Core Fields & CRUD (Week 1)
milestone-1.tasks: - Add 10-15 most important fields (serial, model, manufacturer, etc.) - Add proper DTOs with validation - Add update endpoint (PUT /api/assets/:id) - Add soft delete (status = DISPOSED) - Add basic pagination - Simple edit form in UI

milestone-2.name: Relationships & Categories (Week 2)
milestone-2.goal: Assets connected to projects and users
milestone-2.tasks: - Add project relationship and enforce it - Add assigned user relationship - Add asset categories (minimum 5-10 key ones) - Add filtering by project/user/category - Update UI to show relationships - Add project selector in create/edit forms

milestone-3.name: Location & Organization (Week 3)
milestone-3.tasks: - Add all location fields (building, floor, room) - Add all categorization fields (systems, subsystems) - Create location hierarchy in UI - Add location-based search - Visual location indicators

milestone-4.name: Financial Fields (Week 4)
milestone-4.tasks: - Add all cost fields to assets - Add energy rate fields to projects - Implement cost calculations - Create TCO summary views - Add budget vs actual reporting

milestone-5.name: Technical Specifications (Week 5)
milestone-5.tasks: - Add all technical fields (power, refrigerant, filters, etc.) - Add energy consumption fields - Implement energy calculations - Create specification views (tabbed UI?) - Add technical search capabilities

milestone-6.name: Bulk Operations (Week 6)
milestone-6.tasks: - Bulk create endpoint - Bulk update endpoint - CSV export functionality - Basic CSV import (prepare for full ETL) - Bulk assignment operations

milestone-7.name: Polish & Performance (Week 7)
milestone-7.tasks: - Add all remaining fields - Optimize database indexes - Add caching where needed - Comprehensive error handling - Full test coverage - Performance testing

milestone-8.name: Data Import ETL (Week 8+)
milestone-8.tasks: - Implement data-extraction-guide.xml - Column mapping UI - Validation and cleaning - Import preview - Rollback capability

tracer-bullet.benefits: - Working software in under 2 hours - Can demo immediately - Never in broken state - Each addition is small and testable - Can stop at any point with value

step.name: Database Schema Setup

detailed-tasks.task: 1.1 Update Project model in schema.prisma: - Add energy rate fields (electricityRatePerKwh, demandChargePerKw, etc.) - Add TCO fields (totalFirstCost, annualMaintenanceCost, etc.) - Add relation: assets Asset[]

1.2 Create Asset model in schema.prisma: - Copy flattened schema from this guide - Only 3 required fields: id, assetTag, name - Add indexes for: assetTag, status, projectId, createdAt - Add relations to Project and User
1.3 Create enums: - AssetStatus (ACTIVE, INACTIVE, MAINTENANCE, RETIRED, DISPOSED) - AssetCondition (NEW, EXCELLENT, GOOD, FAIR, POOR)
1.4 Generate and apply migration: ```bash cd apps/backend npx prisma migrate dev --name add_assets_and_project_costs npx prisma generate ```

step.deliverable: Database with Asset and updated Project tables

detailed-tasks.task: 2.1 Generate NestJS scaffolding: ```bash cd apps/backend npx nest g module assets npx nest g controller assets/controllers/assets npx nest g service assets/services/assets ```

2.2 Create service files: - src/assets/services/asset-query.service.ts (read operations) - src/assets/services/asset-command.service.ts (write operations) - src/assets/repositories/asset.repository.ts (database access)

2.3 Create DTOs: - src/assets/dto/create-asset.dto.ts (only assetTag and name required!) - src/assets/dto/update-asset.dto.ts (all fields optional) - src/assets/dto/asset-response.dto.ts (safe output) - src/assets/dto/asset-filters.dto.ts (search/pagination)
2.4 Wire up module dependencies: - Import PrismaService - Export services - Add to app.module.ts
3.1 Implement repository methods: - findMany(filters, pagination) - findById(id) - create(data) - update(id, data) - softDelete(id) - set status to DISPOSED
3.2 Implement service methods: - Use repository, add business logic - Calculate energy costs using Project rates - Handle relationships (project, assignedUser)

3.3 Implement controller endpoints: - GET /api/assets (with pagination, filters) - GET /api/assets/:id - POST /api/assets (minimal required fields!) - PUT /api/assets/:id - DELETE /api/assets/:id (soft delete)
3.4 Add Swagger documentation: - @ApiTags('assets') - @ApiOperation() for each endpoint - Document DTOs with @ApiProperty()
4.1 Bulk operations: - POST /api/assets/bulk (create multiple) - PUT /api/assets/bulk (update multiple)
4.2 Asset assignment: - POST /api/assets/:id/assign (assign to user) - POST /api/assets/:id/transfer (move to project)
4.3 Search and filtering: - Search by tag, serial, name, description - Filter by status, category, project, user - Sort by any indexed field
4.4 Energy cost calculations: - Calculate costs using Project rates - Handle override rates if specified - Sum project totals
5.1 Update Project DTOs: - Add energy rate fields to UpdateProjectDto - Add cost fields to ProjectResponseDto
5.2 Add Project calculations: - GET /api/projects/:id/energy-summary - GET /api/projects/:id/tco-summary - Calculate totals from child assets
5.3 Update Project service: - Calculate total project costs from assets - Update TCO when rates change
6.1 Fix linting issues: ```bash npm run lint --workspace=backend ```
6.2 Fix TypeScript issues: ```bash npm run typecheck --workspace=backend ```
6.3 Write basic tests: - Asset creation with minimal fields - Unique constraint on assetTag - Soft delete functionality - Energy cost calculations
6.4 Manual testing: - Create asset with just tag and name - Update with additional fields - Test search and filters - Verify calculations
7.1 Create API client: - src/services/assetService.ts - Types from backend DTOs
7.2 Asset list page: - Table with pagination - Search and filters - Sort by columns
7.3 Asset form: - Create with minimal fields - Edit with all fields (tabbed interface?) - Handle large number of fields gracefully
7.4 Project enhancements: - Show energy rates in project details - Display project TCO summary - Asset count and total value
8.1 Create import template: - CSV with all field headers - Example data row - Instructions document
8.2 Implement export: - GET /api/assets/export?format=csv - Include all flattened fields
8.3 Document field mappings: - Map CSV headers to database fields - Note required vs optional - Document validation rules

field-reconciliation.instructions: When user provides field list, we will: 1. Map each field to appropriate Prisma/PostgreSQL types 2. Identify required vs optional fields 3. Determine which fields need indexes 4. Define validation rules 5. Identify any calculated/derived fields 6. Determine enum values for categorical fields

considerations.security: - All endpoints require authentication - Users can only see assets in their projects - Role-based permissions for create/update/delete - Audit trail for all changes
considerations.performance: - Index frequently queried fields - Use pagination for list endpoints - Include only necessary relations - Consider caching for read-heavy operations
considerations.business-rules: - Asset tags must be unique system-wide - Assets can only be assigned to active users - Disposed assets cannot be modified - Maintain history of asset assignments
considerations.future-enhancements: - Asset maintenance scheduling - Depreciation tracking - QR code generation for asset tags - Mobile app for asset scanning - Integration with procurement system
